title.narrative: UPDATED EVIDENCE, POLICIES AND STRATEGIES ON Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) AND HIV

description.narrative: Evidence is generated and policies and strategies on Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and HIV are updated to be in line with global recommendations., which contributes to Child Health, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children, adolescents and women use improved and equitable high-impact maternal, newborn and child health (MNCH) and HIV services.

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Technical assistance - Treatment and care of children living with HIV

title.narrative: Rwanda United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2013-2018
Rwanda United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2018-2023
Rwanda Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Health)
UNICEF Programmes in Rwanda (Child Health and HIV/AIDS)
UNICEF Programmes in Rwanda (Humanitarian action and Emergencies)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Rwanda 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence is generated and policies and strategies on MNCH and HIV are updated to be in line with global recommendations.

description.narrative: Rwanda has incorporated the new guidance related to COVID-19 specific measures for MNCAH and HIV by issuing guidance notes for health workers. The existing polices and strategies continue to support implementation of MNCAH and HIV services. With support from UNICEF, obstetric protocol, emergency obstetric care guidelines and training materials, and newborn and obstetric norms and standards were developed. With UNICEF's support the community health policy is being developed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: Electronic patient management system is functional and generates real-time evidence in select hospitals. Indicator rating: 0 no system exists, 1 system piloted, 2 smallscale, 3 scaled up nationally

Operational Plans to improve access and utilization of adolescent HIV intervention in 4 districts and urban areas with high burden of HIV are developed and implemented. Indicator rating: 0 no operational plans, 1 developed, 2 smallscale innovative strategies, 3 district/urban wide scale up
National HIV policy and strategies are updated with focus on reducing new HIV infections among young children and adolescents
National MNCH policy and strategies are updated with focus on highimpact interventions to reduce child mortality
